approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

circulatingSupply().details: returns the circulating amount of tokens on current chain

params._hostChainID: the TOFT host chain LayerZero id

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

estimateSendFee(uint16,bytes32,uint256,b.details: estimate send token `_tokenId` to (`_dstChainId`, `_toAddress`) _dstChainId - L0 defined chain id to send tokens too _toAddress - dynamic bytes array which contains the address to whom you are sending tokens to on the dstChain _amount - amount of the tokens to transfer _useZro - indicates to use zro to pay L0 fees _adapterParam - flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services in L0

params.lzData: data needed for the cross chain transer

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.externalData: external contracts used for the flow

sendFrom(address,uint16,bytes32,uint256,.details: send `_amount` amount of token to (`_dstChainId`, `_toAddress`) from `_from` `_from` the owner of token `_dstChainId` the destination chain identifier `_toAddress` can be any size depending on the `dstChainId`. `_amount` the quantity of tokens in wei `_refundAddress` the address LayerZero refunds if too much message fee is sent `_zroPaymentAddress` set to address(0x0) if not paying in ZRO (LayerZero Token) `_adapterParams` is a flexible bytes array to indicate messaging adapter services

params.approvals: the cross chain approval operation data
params.options: the cross chain send operation data
params.revokes: the cross chain revoke operations data

setCluster(address).details: can only be called by the owner

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

token().details: returns the address of the ERC20 token

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.lzCallParams: data needed to trigger triggerApproveOrRevoke on destination

params.approvals: the cross chain approval operation data
params.revokes: the cross chain revoke operations data
params.sendFromData: data needed to trigger sendFrom on destination

params.approvals: the cross chain approval operation data
params.revokes: the cross chain revoke operations data

params._amount: The amount of tokens to unwrap.
params._toAddress: The address to unwrap the tokens to.

params._chain: the block.chainid of that specific chain

wrap(address,address,uint256).details: Since it can be executed only on the main chain, if an address exists on the OP chain it will not allowed to wrap.

params._amount: The amount of ERC20 to wrap.
params._toAddress: The address to wrap the ERC20 to.

connectedChains(uint256).notice: allowed chains where you can unwrap your TOFT

extractUnderlying(uint256).notice: extracts the underlying token/native for rebalancing

hostChainID().notice: The host chain ID of the ERC20

rescueEth(uint256,address).notice: rescues unused ETH from the contract

retrieveFromStrategy(address,uint256,uin.notice: extracts TOFT from a specific strategy available on another layer

sendForLeverage(uint256,address,(uint256.notice: sends TOFT to a specific chain and performs a leverage down operation

sendToStrategy(address,address,uint256,u.notice: sends TOFT to a specific strategy available on another layer

sendToYBAndBorrow(address,address,uint16.notice: sends TOFT to a specific chain and performs a borrow operation

sgReceive(uint16,bytes,uint256,address,u.notice: needed for Stargate Router to receive funds from Balancer.sol contract

triggerSendFrom(uint16,bytes,address,uin.notice: triggers a sendFrom to another layer from destination

triggerSendFromWithParams(address,uint16.notice: triggers a sendFromWithParams to another layer from destination

unwrap(address,uint256).notice: Unwrap an ERC20/Native with a 1:1 ratio. Called only on host chain.

updateConnectedChain(uint256,bool).notice: updates a connected chain whitelist status

wrap(address,address,uint256).notice: Wrap an ERC20 with a 1:1 ratio with a fee if existing.

documentation.text: @notice allowed chains where you can unwrap your TOFT

@notice map of approved balancers
 @dev a balancer can extract the underlying
@notice event emitted when a connected chain is reigstered or unregistered
@notice event emitted when balancer status is updated

 @param _amount the amount used for rebalancing
